alert.note: Alert for Cook; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 6:28PM CDT until May 14 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Illinois and northwest Indiana, including the following areas, in northeast Illinois, Cook and Will. In northwest Indiana, Lake IN. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy showers and thunderstorms continuing across the area. The heaviest rainfall was located from southern Chicago to near Gary, with rain rates up to one inch in 30 minutes. Up to 1.5 inches of rain fell previously from these storms near Schererville. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... South Chicago, Hammond, Gary, Calumet City, Merrillville, Chicago Heights, East Chicago, Schererville, Hobart, Lansing, Crown Point, Harvey, Highland, Blue Island, Munster, Dolton and Park Forest. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
